description:
Using the following command as admin does not show IPs allocated by the different users:

nova floating-ip-list 

The list of allocated and associated IP addresses can be extracted from "nova list", but there's no easy way for an admin to list floating IP addresses not associated to any server by querying the nova API.
title: unassociated floating IPs not visible to admin

comments.content:
Using the following command as admin does not show IPs allocated by the different users:

nova floating-ip-list 

The list of allocated and associated IP addresses can be extracted from "nova list", but there's no easy way for an admin to list floating IP addresses not associated to any server by querying the nova API.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~andrea-frittoli

comments.content: This seems to affect the EC2 api as well. Using 'euca-describe-addresses', as someone with a cloudadmin role, does not return a list of ip addresses not used by the user's project.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~aglenyoung

comments.content:
Does it work for you if you explicitly specify the tenant identifier using a command line such as:

nova --os_tenant_name=TENANT_ID_GOES_HERE floating-ip-list

I have managed to get a listing by doing this when a simple "nova floating-ip-list" would come up empty.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~llarsson

comments.content: Is this still valid,  this bugs is several years old.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo
